vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
βάτος ὁ,
the Hebrew liquid measure
__C bath, = Egypt. ἀρτάβη or Attic dialect μετρητής, [LXX+NT+1st c.AD+]:—also βάδος, variant in [LXX+5th c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: bath (a unit of liquid measure, between eight and nine gallons)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
bath (a unit of liquid measure, between eight and nine gallons)
a bath, a measure for liquids, which is stated by Josephus (Ant. 8.57) to contain seventy-two sextarii, or about thirteen and one half gallons. Others estimate it to be nine gallons; and others, seven and one half gallons, Lk. 16:6*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: barril ; bath (una medida líquida de 36.92 litros o 8.1 galones)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition: 簍; 舊約譯為"罷特"; 八至九加崙的容量單位 (路 16:6)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition: 篓; 旧约译为"罢特"; 八至九加仑的容量单位 (路 16:6)
